com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.publisher.mbe
Class SPBrandEngageClient

java.lang.Object
  com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.publisher.mbe.SPBrandEngageClient

public class SPBrandEngageClient
extends java.lang.Object

Provides methods to request and show BrandEngage offers and notifies its listener SPBrandEngageClientStatusListener of changes in the status of the engagement.

Before requesting offers, make sure the have called the SponsorPay.start(String, String, String, Activity) method. At this point you can determine if offers are available with requestOffers(com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.credentials.SPCredentials, android.app.Activity). When the engagement is over you must restart the process, querying if offers are available, before you run any engagement again. To check for new virtual coins earned by the user, given you've set your VCS key with the SponsorPay.start(String, String, String, Activity), simply set a SPCurrencyServerListener using setCurrencyListener(SPCurrencyServerListener) and it will be notified after a successful engagement. Note - Offer availability (requestOffers(com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.credentials.SPCredentials, android.app.Activity)) cannot be requested while an engagement is running. Call canRequestOffers() if you're not sure that this instance is in a state in which a request for offers is possible.

Method Detail

startMediationAdapters

public void startMediationAdapters(android.app.Activity activity)

requestOffers

public boolean requestOffers(SPCredentials credentials,
                             android.app.Activity activity)
Queries the server for BrandEngage offers availability. Offer availability cannot be requested while an engagement is running or the server is currently being queried. Call canRequestOffers() if you're not sure that this instance is in a state in which a request for offers is possible.

Parameters:
credentials - The credentials that will be used for this query.
activity - The calling activity
Returns:
true if a request is being made, false otherwise
See Also:
SPCredentials, SponsorPay.start(String, String, String, Activity)

startEngagement

public boolean startEngagement(android.app.Activity activity)
Starts running an available engagement.

Parameters:
activity - The activity that will be used to show the engagement
Returns:
true if the engagement can be started

closeEngagement

public void closeEngagement()
Closes the current engagement

canRequestOffers

public boolean canRequestOffers()
Returns:

Returns:
